revised_title: Observations of Mercury's Transit and the Effects of Atmospheric Turbulence on Telescope Images
tldr: The author describes the observations of the transit of Mercury over the Sun and discusses the effects of atmospheric turbulence on telescope images. They explain how atmospheric agitation can cause indistinctness in telescope images and propose that the apparent indistinctness of Mercury's and the Sun's limbs during previous transits was due to atmospheric turbulence rather than a "luminous crown" or circle of aberration. The author also provides a comparison between refracting and reflecting telescopes, explaining why the effects of atmospheric turbulence are more noticeable in reflecting telescopes.
